availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Capt. Alexander Keene Richards (Scott County, KY horse breeder and plantation owner)

body.p: Born in Georgetown, Scott County, Kentucky, son of Dr. William Lawrence Richards and Eleonora Elizabeth Smith. Owned Blue Grass Park near Georgetown, Scott County, Kentucky, where he bred thoroughbred horses, and a plantation in East Carroll Parish, Louisiana.

bibl.p: Find A Grave, Entry for Alexander Keene Richards (1827-1881), Find A Grave Memorial # 24843093, Georgetown Cemetery, Georgetown, Scott County, Kentucky, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=24843093 (accessed 13 Aug 2017).

Ramage, James A. and Andrea S. Watkins, Kentucky Rising: Democracy, Slavery, and Culture from the Early Republic to the Civil War (Lexington: The University Press of Kentucky, 2011), https://books.google.com/books?id=W839eCdJQccC&pg=PT84&dq=keene+richards&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjg2IPZ1dXVAhWB2iYKHdLOB704ChDoAQhMMAc#v=onepage&q=keene%20richards&f=false
